back_cards.example_en: She walked to the park this morning.
He studied hard to pass the exam.
I gave the book to my friend.
The event runs from Monday to Friday.
This key belongs to the front door.

back_cards.definition_en: Referring to a specific thing or person
back_cards.example_en: That is the house where I grew up.
She said that she would be late.
It was that moment when everything changed.
I’m tired, and that’s why I’m leaving early.
Look at that bird in the tree!

back_cards.definition_en: In the role or function of
back_cards.example_en: She works as a teacher at the school.
He called as I was leaving the house.
Do as I say, not as I do.

back_cards.definition_en: To the same degree or extent
back_cards.example_en: The hike wasn’t as hard as I expected.
Some sports, such as soccer, require teamwork.
I need more time to finish the project.
She bought apples, oranges, and more.
He was more excited than anyone else.
Can you explain that one more time?
This book is more interesting than the last one.
We spent the day at the beach.
It’s warm during the day but cool at night.
Graduation day was unforgettable.
Back in my day, things were different.
She works an eight-hour day.
One of the cookies is missing.
One should always be kind to others.
I need one ticket for the show.
This is one book you must read.
That was one amazing performance!
Her backpack is on the chair.
I saw her at the market yesterday.
That’s her car parked outside.
I gave the gift to her after the party.
Her smile brightened the room.
The keys are over there on the table.
There is a new café downtown.
There are many reasons to stay.
There, now the painting looks perfect!

back_cards.definition_en: At a point in time or process
back_cards.example_en: We’ll stop there for today’s meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicating position above and in contact
back_cards.example_en: The book is on the shelf.
The meeting is on Monday.
She gave a talk on climate change.
The sticker is on the laptop.
They kept on working despite the rain.
No, I can’t come to the party tonight.
There’s no milk left in the fridge.
That’s no way to treat a friend.
No, that’s not what I meant.
No, you didn’t climb that mountain!
She lives in a small village.
We’ll meet in an hour.
He’s in trouble for being late.
The note was written in pencil.
There’s sugar in the recipe.
When does the train arrive?
She called when I was sleeping.
I remember the day when we met.
When in doubt, ask for help.
I’ll leave when I’m ready.
I saw her as I was leaving the store.
He runs as fast as his brother.
As it was raining, we stayed inside.
She sings as beautifully as a professional.
Some fruits, as apples, are sweet.
He walked out of the room.
The fire burned out by morning.
The news came out yesterday.
She was left out of the invitation.
We ran out of milk this morning.
I like to read books in the evening.
Would you like coffee or tea?
They like the new company policy.
She likes her new neighbor a lot.
It feels like spring today.
Where did you park the car?
Where are you going this weekend?
Where do we stand on this issue?
That’s the spot where we met.
I’ll follow you where you go.
All of the cake was eaten.
All students must attend the meeting.
All is well after the storm.
She spent all her money on books.
He was all smiles at the party.
It was so cold we stayed inside.
I was tired, so I went to bed early.
She studied hard so she could pass.
So, what’s the plan for today?
Hold the brush so to avoid drips.
We talked about our weekend plans.
It’s about five miles to the city.
She looked about the room for her keys.
He’s about to leave for work.
Books were scattered about the table.
She found work at a local bakery.
There’s a lot of work to do before the deadline.
Her painting is a beautiful work of art.
He’s at work until 6 p.m.
Teamwork made the project a success.
This is the most beautiful sunset I’ve seen.
Most people prefer summer to winter.
It’s a most interesting book.
Most of the guests arrived on time.
She’s the most talented singer in the group.
You got the right answer on the quiz.
This is the right tool for the job.
It’s not right to lie to your friends.
Everything is right with the car now.
Turn at the right corner.
The store is right across the street.
I’ll call you right after the meeting.
You did it right the first time.
Look right before crossing the road.
The plan went right as expected.
The bridge is a mile long.
It was a long day at work.
She wrote a long list of groceries.
He’s long wanted to visit Paris.
The long wait at the airport was exhausting.
We’ll go to the park after lunch.
The dog ran after the ball.
Her name comes after his on the list.
The room was decorated after a modern design.
After the storm, the streets were flooded.
She enjoyed the concert so much.
There’s much work to be done today.
He doesn’t call much anymore.
This bag is much heavier than that one.
It’s much the same price as before.
Only she knew the secret code.
It’s only a short walk to the station.
I saw him only last week.
You can go, only if you finish your chores.
We have only two tickets left.
There’s a park around the corner.
The trip will take around two hours.
We sat around the campfire.
She looked around the shop for gifts.
They built a wall around the garden.
